description.plain:
I’m Aurora Aksnes, from the west coast of Norway. I’m a dreamer, and a thinker. I write music out of all those thoughts hoping it means something to others than myself.

AURORA is a singer-songwriter, born in 1996 in Stavanger, Norway. A self-taught pianist, she released her first singles in 2012 and 2013. In 2014, she released two more singles, assumed the stage name “AURORA”, and signed to Decca and Glassnote Records.

In 2015, she released her debut EP Running with the Wolves. Her debut album All My Demons Greeting Me As A Friend was released in 2016, to positive reviews and received a score of 80/100 on Metacritic.

She released two parts to her sophomore album,  Infections of a Different Kind (Step I) in late 2018 and A Different Kind of Human (Step II) in mid 2019.

On October 11th, 2021, Aurora announced her 3rd upcoming album, The Gods We Can Touch, along with “Giving Into The Love”, the third single released for the album.

songs.title: Runaway

description.plain:
“Runaway” is the lead single and the first track by Norwegian singer Aurora on her EP Running with the Wolves and on the album All My Demons Greeting Me as a Friend. It was written by  Aurora and Magnus Skylstad and produced by Odd Martin Skålnes and Skylstad. The song was released on 7 February 2015. The demo of the song was leaked in late 2015.

In early 2021, “Runaway” went viral on social media platform TikTok, resulting in new chart successes and streams on various platforms.

songs.full_title: Running with the Wolves by AURORA
songs.title: Running with the Wolves

description.plain:
The song is about having the animal instinct inside you come to life. Running with them, joining them – the instinct taking over, giving you freedom and making you forget about your human self and all things we humans keep around us in the modern society.

I think humans need to let go a bit more, shake their bodies more often, like the animals do.. It’s a beautiful thing really.

Sometimes when you look at the world, and you see what we’ve done to it, the way many of us hurt the world we live in, innocent animals, even our own kind! And that kind of makes you want to follow the wolves instead. At least for one night.



Soundcloud

songs.title: The Seed

description.plain:
Performed for the first time on her early 2018 Europe tour, the song was released as the second single from AURORA’s third studio album.

The song suggests a world where we have been too greedy with our resources, killing our earth for money and that once every resource is gone, trees are fallen and rivers are poisoned, we cannot eat the thing that killed it in the first place. We must protect our environment.

The chorus references the famous proverb:

When the last tree has been cut down, the last fish caught, the last river poisoned, only then will we realize that one cannot eat money.

songs.title: Conqueror

description.plain:
Aurora stated in a 2016 interview that:

‘Conqueror’ is about a world that is kind of falling apart around you, and you’re looking for a conqueror to save you. But you’re looking for the conqueror in someone else, which I think is something you should not do. You should find the conqueror in yourself first, and be your own hero. If you stand strong, then you will stand for a bit longer.

Fascinatingly in the YouTube description, Aurora addressed “Conqueror” to boys, subverting gender norms and the outdated idea that women are men’s conquests:

This video is for the little boy who couldn’t find the conqueror in himself. The conqueror is within you.

songs.title: Winter Bird

description.plain:
This song draws parallels between nature and the soul – suggesting that our view of the world around us is influenced by our emotions and our history.

As explained by Aurora:

“Sometimes you need to be reminded of how it was to feel alive. It’s a tricky situation to find yourself in.. When you’ve forgotten about your reasons to live.”

songs.title: Forgotten Love

description.plain:
“Forgotten Love” is the 2nd single off AURORA’s second EP, Infections of a Different Kind (Step 1). The song was first performed live on April 12, 2018, in Phoenix, Arizona, and officially released on August 17th.

Aurora herself has stated that there’s no real language behind the verse that seems to be Norwegian, rather it is a language invented by herself that only she can understand. She also revealed in an interview for The L'Officiel USA in September 2018:

My own language is an emotional language and it means what you need it to mean in the now. It’s very liberating to sing the words because I can change the energy in them. My newest song, “Forgotten Love,” has my own language in the second chorus, and you can feel the melody and instruments without having any input on what I’m saying."

songs.title: It Happened Quiet

description.plain:
“It Happened Quiet” is the fifth song on AURORA’s sophomore album. It was performed for the first time on December 11, 2017 for a Christmas concert in Nidarosdomen, Norway.

The song describes how Aurora felt within a sad and very complicated relationship. It talked about the happy moments they shared and how whenever they were behind closed doors, the relationship developed into something far more drastic and terrifying. Aurora expresses how her partner always pictured the world as such a dark place that all they wanted to do is protect her from the outside world. What this person did always resulted in violence for the love they had for Aurora, but every time things like that happened, she was hurting. Over time, she talks about how if she carried on being in the relationship any longer, than she would hurt and bleed until there was nothing left of her but a constant reminder of what that person lost.

The song seems to have connection with the song “Murder Song” from her first album “All My Demons Gretting Me As A Friend”
Having the same story, where that person kills her lover
The song “It Happened Quiet” has more hints about what happened, but still has the same story.
Being one of the saddest songs of the EP. or album of the artist, with that reference of the murder with a very peculiar word “Love Is Wild”

songs.title: The River

description.plain:
“The River” centers around people hiding or holding back their emotions because of the stigma that by letting them out comes across as being weak. It talks about how letting our emotions out into the world proves that we are human and forms a part of what makes us human (being able to feel feelings and have emotions) and how sometimes letting them out can make you feel so much better afterwards.

“The River” is the third single from AURORA’s third studio album.

It talks about how letting our emotions out into the world proves that we are human and forms a part of what makes us human (being able to feel feelings and have emotions) and how sometimes letting them out can make you feel so much better afterwards.

“The River” is the third single from AURORA’s third studio album.

songs.title: Warrior

description.plain:
This song is an anthem for Aurora’s fans (who she calls ‘'Warriors and Weirdos’‘). It is also a song that reminds us that even if we find ourselves in dark times, we must fight. We cannot surrender, because only through darkness we can see the light. Using her words:

“I call myself a warrior even though I’ve never held a sword or anything else that can hurt people physically, but people have fights in their lives, small and and big. And it’s a nice thought, that people can walk around and call themselves warriors, which they should do, whether they’re a fan of me or not. It’s strong. It’s important to remember that, how strong we are.”

From Red Bull sessions, AURORA stated that “Warrior is kind of about, what I kind of think is, the meaning of humans life is to be kind to other humans. You know in the verse I say "I can’t recall the last time I opened my eyes to see the word as beautiful” and it’s kind of about being a bit not disappointed but I guess a bit like the more you grow, the more you realize how many dark sides life contains in the word and people. And you know it can be a very sad thing that we are doing all these things against each other and that’s kind of what the song is about."

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DySnX5TwMMw

songs.title: Exist For Love

description.plain:
“Exist for Love” is the first single by AURORA in 2020, following “Apple Tree” and her collaboration “Into the Unknown” with Idina Menzel from the soundtrack of Frozen 2 in 2019. The song is a ballad of love, which AURORA remarked on in a tweet:

🔮 i never thought that i would ever write a song about love. But now i am ready. My heart is ready.

She also alluded that this could be her first single for her third studio album. Some snippets of the lyrics were posted to her Instagram account on May 12, along with the cover art divided into nine parts, where the ninth and last part revealed the song’s release date.

songs.full_title: Half the World Away by AURORA
songs.title: Half the World Away

description.plain:
Aurora follows in the footsteps of Lily Allen and Tom Odell as she recorded the main theme of the 2015 John Lewis Christmas advert.

The music video, directed by Kenny McCracken, was released on 12 November 2015.

It’s an adapted version of the original song with the same name by Oasis, which was released in 1994 as the theme song for BBC’s sitcom The Royle Family.

“Queendom” is the lead single from Aurora’s second EP, Infections of a Different Kind (Step 1), which was released as the first part of a two-part album.

The song was first played live in Salvador, Brazil during her “All My Demons Tour” at the country (October, 2017) and officially announced on April 11st.

songs.title: Animal

description.plain:
Released on January 24, 2019, “Animal” is the first single from her album, A Different Kind of Human (Step II).

It was first teased on January 21, where a snippet of the song was sent to those subscribed in her messenger. More was revealed on the 22nd when she sent 6 different other snippets of the instrumental randomly to those in the messenger, leaving it to them to piece it together.

On Instagram, Aurora writes: “ANIMAL for me is a very ironical song. It’s raw because we are raw, it’s sensual because nature is sensual. It’s wrong and strange because the world is wrong and strange. It’s free because we should be free. There is a lot of things I hate about us, (next to all the things I love) and part of me hate the industrial part of the music industry. And that is exactly why the song had to sound the way it did. Because it’s a way for me to make. A bit fun of it. Still Aurora, but with elements form that world. For me, It amplifies the irony in all of it. The world we all have mixed feelings about. Because it’s so easy to show people something horrible, something deep and we still choose what we want to see. And that is the must fun thing with it all.”

songs.title: PARAMOUR

description.plain:
“PARAMOUR” is a song by Sub Urban which features Norwegian singer-songwriter AURORA.

This song was originally teased by Sub Urban himself via Instagram stories after being asked “what have you been doing in quarantine”, to which he replied with a snippet of the song, hinting that he had been working on music.

Later, on November 10th, 2021, he uploaded a snippet to his TikTok. The audio attached to the video was copyrighted under “PARAMOUR (feat. AURORA)”. The song was also copyrighted as a single.

The song officially released on November 19th alongside a music video featuring AURORA.

songs.title: Home

description.plain:
This song deals with depression and how it can sometimes overcome us; how sometimes we need to numb ourselves in order to feel at home. In Aurora’s words:

It’s not a good way of living, making yourself numb, trying to let every day pass by as quickly as possible. But at least it makes us happy for a while. We are home."

Even though by numbing ourselves we can feel ‘warm’ for a little while, there is no way one can live like this; this is only surviving, nothing more.

songs.full_title: Infections of a Different Kind by AURORA
songs.title: Infections of a Different Kind

description.plain:
“Infections of a Different Kind” is the title track and final track on Aurora’s new album of the same name. It was the only song from the tracklist that was never performed live prior the release of the album. Only a couple of things were known about the song in general: the line “Be God in the shape of a girl” as Aurora wrote on the arm of an Argentine fan on April 2018, and Aurora herself described it as “the most important song I’ve ever written” and as “the seed” for Step 1.

When asked about the God references in the song during an “Ask me anything” online dynamic, Aurora explained: “I have a lot of questions about religions and the way people have fought, and killed and saved in its name. So in this song I’m looking at it from the view of a person in pain. Who asks for god to be in all of us. Not something we can’t touch, or someone who judges. I believe in the world and everything in it. And I spend my energy in places where I believe it will do good”.

description.plain:
“Churchyard” is the sixth track on Aurora’s second album, Infections of a Different Kind (Step I).

The song is about someone “powerful” who uses their power in the wrong way, like in politics, with children or women. It talks about someone harling words of abuse or harassment at people and then, like karma, finally hitting back and haunting that person.

description.plain:
“All Is Soft Inside” is a song recorded by AURORA for her second album, Infections of a Different Kind (Step I).

The song describes a moment in her life where she felt like she was defenseless in a time of need. She continues by telling the listener how her barriers were broken and torn away to reveal her softer insides and what was most vulnerable.

songs.full_title: A Different Kind of Human by AURORA
songs.title: A Different Kind of Human

description.plain:
“A Different Kind of Human” is the title track of singer-songwriter and producer AURORA’s third studio album. With sparse production reminiscent of “Infections of a Different Kind”, the title track of her previous album, AURORA sings about her own take on the afterlife. She assures the listener that they are special and that they shouldn’t worry — they’ll someday be taken to a safer place, where they can live forever in peace.

Like in previous releases, “A Different Kind of Human” follows AURORA’s trend of placing her favorite song as the eighth track in her album. When asked by Interview Magazin if there was a track that was particularly close to her, she said:

Track 8 throughout my career is always the most important track.

songs.title: Cure For Me

description.plain: “Cure For Me” is a single to AURORA’s upcoming third studio album. In an interview with NME, AURORA talks about how the track was inspired by countries that still have legalized conversion therapy for LGBTQ+ people. This song is an anthem of self love and how we are all perfect no matter our differences or what society may deem as “irregular.” Sonically, the track experiments with a more “playful” sound different from what AURORA has done in previous songs.

songs.title: Apple Tree

description.plain:
“Apple Tree” finds AURORA being hopeful that we can all save the world together. The track’s sound stands out in her discography as one of her most different tracks, with her vocal delivery during the verses displaying a flow comparable to rap music.

During a Step II listening party and Q&A held on June 13, 2019, AURORA gave insights on the production of the song. She confirmed that the beat of the track was influenced by Brazilian’s Olodum, which she came in contact when she first went to Salvador in 2017. There’s also hip-hop influences because she “felt it deserved a very alive and bad-ass groove”.

songs.title: Gentle Earthquakes

description.plain:
“Gentle Earthquakes” is the third track from AURORA’s second album Infections of a Different Kind (Step I). The song was the third to be teased on her social media five days after its release, following singles “Queendom” and “Forgotten Love”, predicting that she would eventually tease all the tracks from the album in chronological order of the album tracklist.

The itself is an anxiety anthem about how tense the world around becomes and how sudden and quick it can build and take over, even in when or where you least expect it. The song came to Aurora’s mind in early 2018, while she was spending time in the studio at La Fabrique, in the South of France. She said to Dork magazine:

“The whole song is inspired by the dream I had the night before I woke up that morning (…) I dreamt about walking in the same halls and about making music: I couldn’t leave in any way before I finished my work”.

songs.title: Everything Matters

description.plain:
Everything Matters is Track 2 and the 5th single released from AURORA’s 3rd studio album, The Gods We Can Touch, released alongside A Dangerous Thing.

In an interview with NME, AURORA said that “… I do often feel like this world is trying to make me focus on all these great miracles. And somehow I feel like it makes me miss out on the small ones. And that is sad. Because the small miracles happen all the time. Sometimes several times a day. And I want to see all of them. Because everything matters.”

songs.title: Soulless Creatures

description.plain:
In the sixth track off A Different Kind Of Human (Step II), Aurora portrays someone who’s been torn apart by such a machiavellian person that it appears they didn’t possess a soul; probably given by the fact that this person lacked empathy and humanity. Nevertheless, she keeps her faith and positivity.

That kind of hurt didn’t leave her bruised for life, but her wounds aren’t fully healed. Aurora walked through a dark path that eventually led her to self development, as she begins to discover new things about herself and to reflect back on what she still has and what was given away.

songs.title: Black Water Lilies

description.plain:
Aurora was inspired to write this song after a dream, saying in an interview:

“Black Water Lilies” was a dream I had. The melody was playing in the background. And I was dreaming that there was a hand, and I grabbed it, and it took me underwater. And there was a river, under the water, running down. And I floated on the river, under the water, and I came to this magic place with lots of black water lilies – floating on the water – which was underneath the water. It was a very strange dream. When I woke up I ran straight to the piano and wrote the song."

songs.title: In Boxes

description.plain:
The song details a lonely woman who murders people and keeps their body parts in boxes.

Through clever use of language and phrases, every line’s meaning can double as her simply talking about past relationships. Therein lies the possibility the entire song is simply an extended metaphor.

songs.title: Heathens

description.plain:
“Heathens” is Track 7 and the fourth single released from AURORA’s 3rd studio album, The Gods We Can Touch.

In an interview with NME, AURORA stated that the song was about how

[…] Eve took a bite of a forbidden apple hanging from the tree of evil and good. In her act of doing so, she granted humans free will; I just think that was very beautiful, and I wanted to honor her and women like her, who little by little granted us freedom in this world.

songs.title: All My Demons

description.plain:
“All My Demons” is the track that inspired the title of AURORA’S 2016 debut album All My Demons Greeting Me As A Friend, with the only full live recording of the track taking place at an outdoor concert on the Norwegian island of Giske in July 2015.

Whilst AURORA did record a rough studio version of “All My Demons”, she revealed in an interview that she would not be releasing the song on her debut because she was not satisfied with the final recording.

songs.title: Wisdom Cries

description.plain:
Aurora explained the meaning of the song in a 2018 interview in Paris:

‘'It’s about… Humans and the world. We have spent so many years, millions of years collecting wisdom and learning about each other, respect, knowledge and all of the things we should know. Then I feel like if Wisdom was a person, maybe, he/she’d look down upon us and see all the things we do towards the planet, the animals, the women, the men and the children… I think Wisdom would cry because we spend like a second tearing down what we have spent millions of years becoming, if that makes sense. And it’s… sad’'

songs.title: Under Stars

description.plain: Of the song, Aurora says: “It’s about us. About the people we’ve lost through time, and how we handle that loss. The guilt of still being alive when they are not, and the hope that they might only be sleeping, maybe still dreaming, under the stars.“

songs.title: Mothership

description.plain:
Mothership is the outro track of AURORA’s sophomore album A Different Kind of Human – and also serves as a continuation of the title track; by interpolating part of the lyrics and melody.

In doing this, AURORA has ended the saga of the album by informing the listener that, the different kind of human has returned home via the mothership. This is confirmed within the call-and-response style lyrics where AURORA answers “you are home”.

songs.title: Artemis

description.plain:
Artemis is the 12th track off of AURORA’s third studio album, “The Gods We Can Touch”.

Artemis, in Greek Mythology, is the goddess of the moon and hunt. She is the counterpart to her twin brother, Apollo, who is the god of the Sun and Medicine. She is one fo the three Virgin goddesses, along side Athena and Hestia.

songs.full_title: I Had A Dream by AURORA
songs.title: I Had A Dream

description.plain:
This song deals with conflict, confrontation, materialism and wilful ignorance – all topics we struggle with in today’s world.

This was the song that lead to Aurora being signed to her record label, after she performed it at her high school graduation.

She described it in an interview as being nine minutes long and with no chorus, but perhaps this perception of what is, clearly, a beautiful and insightful song was a product of nervousness due to performing it!

songs.title: Scarborough Fair

description.plain:
“Scarbourough Fair” is an English folklore song which was exclusively recorded by AURORA, it was used as the opening theme of the Brazilian telenovela “Deus Salve o Rei” (God Save the King). The music video was shot at “Estúdios Globo in Brazil” and uses scenarios from the telenovela. On April 6, 2018 the song was released on Spotify, but it can only be heard in Brazil.

“Deus Salve o Rei” is a Brazilian telenovela. It’s the first medieval telenovela of “Rede Globo” and involves disputes between two kingdoms (Montemor and Artena).

songs.title: Puppet

description.plain:
“Puppet” is the first song ever released by Aurora Aksnes. The song went viral in Norway, making Aurora take her first steps into the music industry.

It tells the story of a lonely woman who controls/hypnotizes men, killing them if things didn’t go her way. Its narrative ties very closely to her other song, “In Boxes” which tells the story of a lonely woman who kills men and keeps their bodies/body parts as souvenirs.

songs.full_title: Running with the Wolves (Wolfwalkers Version) by AURORA
songs.title: Running with the Wolves (Wolfwalkers Version)

description.plain:
“Running with the Wolves (WolfWalkers Version)” is a rendition of AURORA’s single of the same name, which was originally released in 2015. This version was created in collaboration with Cartoon Saloon for their 2020 film “WolfWalkers”, which was used in both the film and the film’s trailer.

The major difference between the two is that this one features medieval Irish instruments as its backing track.

songs.title: Midas Touch

description.plain:
The Midas Touch is a mythological allusion about an ancient greek king Midas’s ability of turning things he touched into gold. Owing to his kind treat to Dionysus’s teacher Silenus, Dionysus offered Midas his choice of whatever reward he wished for. Midas asked that whatever he might touch should be changed into gold. This appealing ability soon turned out to be a curse. Midas found that he could not eat because foods were transformed into gold when he touch them. Even worse, he turned his daughter into a golden sculpture when he tried to comfort her. He prayed to Dionysus, begging to be delivered from starvation. Dionysus heard his prayer, and consented, telling Midas to wash in the river Pactolus. Midas did so, and when he touched the water, the power flowed into the river, and the river sands turned into gold.

In the song aurora uses this metaphor to indicate an unhealthy relationship a couple of lovers may have. Midas thought he glorified his lover by his status, but he never got a glimpse of her lonely heart.

songs.full_title: Muéstrate by Carmen Sarahi & Leslie Gil (Ft. Carmen Sarahi & Leslie Gil)
songs.title: Muéstrate

description.plain:
“Muéstrate” es una canción para la banda sonora oficial en español de Frozen 2. Esta canción es la versión en español de “Show Yourself” de Indina Menzel y Evan Rachel Wood, esta vez interpretada por Carmen Sarahi y Leslie Gil.

A pesar de que Disney ha estado aclamando más a “Mucho Más Allá” (“Into The Unknown”.), los espectadores aclaman más esta, ya que su forma de expresión junto a la escena de esta, es más superficial y sentimental. Además es considerada como un himno para “salir del clóset” por la comunidad LGBT. Al igual que “Libre Soy” (“Let It Go”.), han servido como un símbolo de aceptar quien eres en realidad.

songs.full_title: Across The Universe - triple j Like A Version by AURORA
songs.title: Across The Universe - triple j Like A Version
songs.title_with_featured: Across The Universe - triple j Like A Version

description.plain:
AURORA covered “Across the Universe” by The Beatles for Australian radio station triple j’s Like A Version segment.

Even though the original song was released long before she was born, AURORA considers it to be one of her all-time favorites. At triple j, she mentioned loving the band’s work since a young age:

I was around 14 when I really got into it [The Beatles], especially “Tomorrow Never Knows” — Revolver, that album. I really love the soundscape in that album, so that was when I really became a fan.

songs.title: Sofia

description.plain:
“Sofia” is a song dedicated to and inspired by Sofia Patranas Martinez, an 8 year old who suffered and ultimately succumbed to a rare form of cancer. Askjell discovered her because Sofia was a cousin of a member in Askjell’s discord server.

“Sofia” features AURORA & iris, two of Sofia’s favorite artists. She got to hear the demo version before she passed away on June 7, 2020.

“Sofia” is Askjell’s first single after releasing his second EP,  To Be Loved late 2019.

songs.full_title: The Devil is Human by AURORA
songs.title: The Devil is Human

description.plain:
Originally called “Father Don’t Blame Us” (as discovered in various song repertoires in September 2020), “The Devil Is Human” is one of 2 exclusive tracks on the vinyl edition of The Gods We Can Touch.

The song is seemingly about trying to live as human, despite your differences, and being punished for it. It is also referencing the witch trials, and how women were unrightfully killed.

body.plain:
Originally called “Father Don’t Blame Us” (as discovered in various song repertoires in September 2020), “The Devil Is Human” is one of 2 exclusive tracks on the vinyl edition of The Gods We Can Touch.

The song is seemingly about trying to live as human, despite your differences, and being punished for it. It is also referencing the witch trials, and how women were unrightfully killed.

songs.lyrics:
The Devil is Human Lyrics
Father, don't blame us for trying to live
For trying to love, for wanting more
Father, don't blame us for trying to bleed
Like real human beings and nothing more

Why did you dress our pleasure up as greed?
While you're limiting our life, taking sunlights from the sea?
Why did you give us hearts we don't understand
Like an apple in our hand that you never let us have?

And I hear you don't like it
I don't care if you don't

Father, don't blame us for trying to live
For trying to love, for wanting more
Father, don't blame us for trying to bleed
Like real human beings and nothing morе

Oh, do you envy how I'm free
How life for me is green, running barеfoot through the fields?
Oh, does it hurt how I don't look at you with fear?
Do you like to watch me kneel, 'cause the way it makes you feel?
And I hear you don't like it
I don't care if you don't

Father, don't blame us for trying to live
For trying to love, for wanting more
Father, don't blame us for trying to bleed
Like real human beings and nothing more

You can burn the skin I live in
But you cannot burn the witch awayEmbed

songs.title: Runaway (Demo)

description.plain:
Runaway is the lead single and the first track on the album “All My Demons Greeting Me as a Friend”.
In February 7, 2015 the song was officially released worldwide.
The demo of the song was leaked in late 2015.

songs.embed_content: Read “Runaway (Demo)” by AURORA on Genius

body.plain:
Runaway is the lead single and the first track on the album “All My Demons Greeting Me as a Friend”.
In February 7, 2015 the song was officially released worldwide.
The demo of the song was leaked in late 2015.

songs.lyrics:

But when I picked it up

Waiting, impatient, for me

And I was running far away
Would I run off the world someday?
Nobody knows, nobody knows
And I was dancing in the rain
I felt alive and I can't complain

But now take me home
Take me home where I belong
I can't take it anymore

I kept running home
